title: Add loading indicator before AI streaming starts
description:
Implement a loading indicator that shows between when the user sends a message and when the AI streaming response begins.

## Context
Currently there's a gap between message submission and first streaming token where the UI provides no feedback to the user. This creates uncertainty about whether the request was received.

## UX Best Practices (Research 2024-2025)
- Pulsing dots typing indicator (widely used pattern)
- Show immediately on message send
- Hide when first streaming token arrives
- Avoid flickering for sub-1-second delays
- Provide immediate user feedback

## Technical Implementation
- Use Textual LoadingIndicator widget or custom pulsing dots animation
- Show in message area where assistant response will appear
- Trigger: When user submits message (Enter key or send button)
- Remove: When ChatView receives first streaming content token
- Position: Below last user message, styled as assistant message preview

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Loading indicator appears immediately after message submission
- [ ] Indicator shows pulsing/animated dots (not static)
- [ ] Indicator disappears smoothly when streaming begins
- [ ] No flickering for fast responses (<1 second)
- [ ] Indicator styled consistently with assistant messages
- [ ] Works for both keyboard (Enter) and mouse (send button) submission

## References
- ChatGPT/Claude use pulsing dots before streaming
- Terminal implementation: use Textual's LoadingIndicator or custom animation
- Common patterns: '...' with sequential pulse, or '|/-\' spinner
